itemDescription: Church of Ireland Archbishop of Dublin

wikipedia_page.main: Michael Geoffrey St Aubyn Jackson (born 24 May 1956) is a Church of Ireland Anglican bishop. Since 2011, he has served as the Archbishop of Dublin and Bishop of Glendalough in the Church of Ireland. He is also the co-chairman of the Porvoo Communion of Anglican and Lutheran churches.

response: *  1956   – Michael Jackson, Irish archbishop
* May 24 – Michael Jackson, Irish Anglican bishop

The leader of the southern province is the Archbishop of Dublin, at present Michael Jackson; that of the northern province is the Archbishop of Armagh, at present Francis John McDowell. These two archbishops are styled Primate of Ireland and Primate of All Ireland respectively, suggesting the ultimate seniority of the latter. Although he has relatively little absolute authority, the Archbishop of Armagh is respected as the church's general leader and spokesman, and is elected in a process different from those for all other bishops.

He retired on 5 October 2001, his sixty-fifth birthday.Clogher Diocese Says Farewell To Retiring Bishop On 21 November, the Church of Ireland House of Bishops met in Dublin,New Bishop of Clogher where they elected his successor, Michael Jackson.Church of Ireland to Elect New Bishop of Clogher Hannon died on 10 January 2022, at the age of 85.
Michael Jackson (1958–2009) was an American singer, songwriter and dancer known as the "King of Pop".
Michael Jackson, Mike Jackson, or Mick Jackson may also refer to:
* Michael Jackson (radio commentator) (1934–2022), American radio talk show host, KABC and KGIL, Los Angeles
* Michael Jackson (writer) (1942–2007), Beer Hunter show host, beer and whisky expert
* Michael Jackson (television executive) (born 1958), British television executive
* Michael Jackson (actor) (born 1970), Canadian actor
* Michael Jackson (English singer) (born 1964), British singer with the heavy metal band Satan/Pariah
* Oh No (musician) or Michael Jackson (born 1978), American rapper
* Michael Jackson (American soldier) (1734–1801), soldier from Massachusetts, wounded at Bunker Hill
* Salman Raduyev or Michael Jackson (1967–2002), Chechen warlord
* Michael Jackson (linebacker) (born 1957), American NFL linebacker (1979–1986)
* Michael Jackson (footballer, born 1963), Brazilian association footballer
* Michael Jackson (basketball) (born 1964), American NBA pro basketball player, Sacramento Kings (1987–1990)
* Michael Jackson (wide receiver) (1969–2017), American politician and NFL wide receiver
* Michael Jackson (rugby league) (born 1969), rugby league footballer for Great Britain, Wakefield Trinity, Halifax
* Michael Jackson (footballer, born 1980), English footballer
* Michael Jackson (anthropologist) (born 1940), New Zealand, professor of social anthropology and writer
* Michael Jackson (murderer) (born 1954), American convicted murderer
* Michael Jackson (bishop) (born 1956), Church of Ireland Archbishop of Dublin, Ireland, since 2011
* Michael Jackson (journalist), Niuean journalist and former politician
* Michael Jackson, American criminal with Tiffany Cole
* "Michael Jackson", a song by Cash Cash from The Beat Goes On
* "Michael Jackson", a song by Das Racist from Relax
* "Michael Jackson", a song by Fatboy Slim, B-side of "Going Out of My Head"
* "Michael Jackson", a song by The Mitchell Brothers
* "Michael Jackson", a song by Negativland from Escape from Noise

At present the Archbishop of Armagh in the Catholic Church is Eamon Martin. John McDowell holds the equivalent office in the Church of Ireland. The current Catholic Archbishop of Dublin is Dermot Farrell. The current Church of Ireland Archbishop of Dublin is Michael Jackson.

link_mentions.page: Order of precedence in Northern Ireland
response: ##Archbishop of Dublin (Church of Ireland) (Michael Jackson)
| Michael Jackson

Lorcán's heart was returned to Ireland and is preserved in a reliquary in Christ Church Cathedral, Dublin. Lorcán's heart remains in Christ Church Cathedral despite the Irish Reformation, although devotion to saints is more prominent in Roman Catholicism than in the Anglicanism of the Church of Ireland which owns the cathedral. The reliquary was stolen in 2012, with the Dean of Christ Church saying "It has no economic value, but it is a priceless treasure that links our present foundation with its founding father".CBS News World – Heart of Dublin's patron saint stolen from church It was recovered in Phoenix Park in 2018 after a tip-off to the Garda Síochána. Media reported that the unidentified thieves thought it was cursed and caused family members' illnesses. At a special evensong ceremony in Christ Church on 26 April 2018, archbishop Michael Jackson received the heart from a senior Garda.

* Michael Jackson, the current Church of Ireland Archbishop of Dublin and Glendalough, lived in Ballinamallard in his youth. Archbishop Jackson previously served as Church of Ireland Lord Bishop of Clogher.
